member.name: M:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.FilesResource.Create(Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File)
member.summary: Creates a new file. This method supports an */upload* URI and accepts uploaded media with the following characteristics: - *Maximum file size:* 5,120 GB - *Accepted Media MIME types:*`*/*` Note: Specify a valid MIME type, rather than the literal `*/*` value. The literal `*/*` is only used to indicate that any valid MIME type can be uploaded. For more information on uploading files, see [Upload file data](/drive/api/guides/manage-uploads). Apps creating shortcuts with `files.create` must specify the MIME type `application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut`. Apps should specify a file extension in the `name` property when inserting files with the API. For example, an operation to insert a JPEG file should specify something like `"name": "cat.jpg"` in the metadata. Subsequent `GET` requests include the read-only `fileExtension` property populated with the extension originally specified in the `title` property. When a Google Drive user requests to download a file, or when the file is downloaded through the sync client, Drive builds a full filename (with extension) based on the title. In cases where the extension is missing, Drive attempts to determine the extension based on the file's MIME type.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.FilesResource.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a file's metadata or content by ID. If you provide the URL parameter `alt=media`, then the response includes the file contents in the response body. Downloading content with `alt=media` only works if the file is stored in Drive. To download Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides use [`files.export`](/drive/api/reference/rest/v3/files/export) instead. For more information, see [Download & export files](/drive/api/guides/manage-downloads).

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.FilesResource.List
member.summary: Lists the user's files. This method accepts the `q` parameter, which is a search query combining one or more search terms. For more information, see the [Search for files & folders](/drive/api/guides/search-files) guide. *Note:* This method returns *all* files by default, including trashed files. If you don't want trashed files to appear in the list, use the `trashed=false` query parameter to remove trashed files from the results.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.FilesResource.ListRequest
member.summary: Lists the user's files. This method accepts the `q` parameter, which is a search query combining one or more search terms. For more information, see the [Search for files & folders](/drive/api/guides/search-files) guide. *Note:* This method returns *all* files by default, including trashed files. If you don't want trashed files to appear in the list, use the `trashed=false` query parameter to remove trashed files from the results.

member.summary: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Each key sorts ascending by default, but can be reversed with the 'desc' modifier. Example usage: ?orderBy=folder,modifiedTime desc,name.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.FilesResource.Update(Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File,System.String)
member.summary: Updates a file's metadata and/or content. When calling this method, only populate fields in the request that you want to modify. When updating fields, some fields might be changed automatically, such as `modifiedDate`. This method supports patch semantics. This method supports an */upload* URI and accepts uploaded media with the following characteristics: - *Maximum file size:* 5,120 GB - *Accepted Media MIME types:*`*/*` Note: Specify a valid MIME type, rather than the literal `*/*` value. The literal `*/*` is only used to indicate that any valid MIME type can be uploaded. For more information on uploading files, see [Upload file data](/drive/api/guides/manage-uploads).

When updating fields, some fields might be changed automatically, such as `modifiedDate`. This method supports patch semantics. This method supports an */upload* URI and accepts uploaded media with the following characteristics: - *Maximum file size:* 5,120 GB - *Accepted Media MIME types:*`*/*` Note: Specify a valid MIME type, rather than the literal `*/*` value. The literal `*/*` is only used to indicate that any valid MIME type can be uploaded. For more information on uploading files, see [Upload file data](/drive/api/guides/manage-uploads).
member.remarks:

Caller is responsible for maintaining the open until the upload is completed

member.summary: Whether the content of the file is read-only. If a file is read-only, a new revision of the file may not be added, comments may not be added or modified, and the title of the file may not be modified.

member.summary: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this shared drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on `drive.drives.update` requests that don't set `themeId`. When specified, all fields of the `backgroundImageFile` must be set.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageLink
member.summary: Output only. A short-lived link to this shared drive's background image.

member.summary: Output only. Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

member.summary: The color of this shared drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a `drive.drives.update` request that does not set `themeId`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.CreatedTimeRaw
member.summary: The time at which the shared drive was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.CreatedTimeDateTimeOffset
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.CreatedTime
member.summary: representation of .

member.summary: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

member.summary: Output only. The ID of this shared drive which is also the ID of the top level folder of this shared drive.

member.summary: Output only. Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string `"drive#drive"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.Name
member.summary: The name of this shared drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.OrgUnitId
member.summary: Output only. The organizational unit of this shared drive. This field is only populated on `drives.list` responses when the `useDomainAdminAccess` parameter is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.Restrictions
member.summary: A set of restrictions that apply to this shared drive or items inside this shared drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.ThemeId
member.summary: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible `driveThemes` can be retrieved from a `drive.about.get` response. When not specified on a `drive.drives.create` request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set `colorRgb` or `backgroundImageFile`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageFileData
member.summary: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this shared drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on `drive.drives.update` requests that don't set `themeId`. When specified, all fields of the `backgroundImageFile` must be set.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageFileData.Id
member.summary: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background image.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageFileData.Width
member.summary: The width of the cropped image in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the width of the cropped image divided by the width of the entire image. The height is computed by applying a width to height aspect ratio of 80 to 9. The resulting image must be at least 1280 pixels wide and 144 pixels high.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageFileData.XCoordinate
member.summary: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the horizontal distance from the left side of the entire image to the left side of the cropping area divided by the width of the entire image.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.BackgroundImageFileData.YCoordinate
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the vertical distance from the top side of the entire image to the top side of the cropping area divided by the height of the entire image.

member.summary: Output only. Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

member.summary: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.RestrictionsData.CopyRequiresWriterPermission
member.summary: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is set to `true`, it will override the similarly named field to `true` for any file inside this shared drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.RestrictionsData.DomainUsersOnly
member.summary: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this shared drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Drive.RestrictionsData.SharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermission
member.summary: If true, only users with the organizer role can share folders. If false, users with either the organizer role or the file organizer role can share folders.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File
member.summary: The metadata for a file. Some resource methods (such as `files.update`) require a `fileId`. Use the `files.list` method to retrieve the ID for a file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.AppProperties
member.summary: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests. These properties can only be retrieved using an authenticated request. An authenticated request uses an access token obtained with a OAuth 2 client ID. You cannot use an API key to retrieve private properties.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Capabilities
member.summary: Output only. Capabilities the current user has on this file. Each capability corresponds to a fine-grained action that a user may take.

member.summary: Additional information about the content of the file. These fields are never populated in responses.

member.summary: Restrictions for accessing the content of the file. Only populated if such a restriction exists.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CopyRequiresWriterPermission
member.summary: Whether the options to copy, print, or download this file, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

member.summary: The time at which the file was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

member.summary: representation of .

member.summary: A short description of the file.

member.summary: Output only. ID of the shared drive the file resides in. Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ExplicitlyTrashed
member.summary: Output only. Whether the file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed from a parent folder.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ExportLinks
member.summary: Output only. Links for exporting Docs Editors files to specific formats.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.FileExtension
member.summary: Output only. The final component of `fullFileExtension`. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.FolderColorRgb
member.summary: The color for a folder or a shortcut to a folder as an RGB hex string. The supported colors are published in the `folderColorPalette` field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, the closest color in the palette is used instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.FullFileExtension
member.summary: Output only. The full file extension extracted from the `name` field. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as "tar.gz". This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive. This is automatically updated when the `name` field changes, however it is not cleared if the new name does not contain a valid extension.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.HasAugmentedPermissions
member.summary: Output only. Whether there are permissions directly on this file. This field is only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.HasThumbnail
member.summary: Output only. Whether this file has a thumbnail. This does not indicate whether the requesting app has access to the thumbnail. To check access, look for the presence of the thumbnailLink field.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.HeadRevisionId
member.summary: Output only. The ID of the file's head revision. This is currently only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.IconLink
member.summary: Output only. A static, unauthenticated link to the file's icon.

member.summary: The ID of the file.

member.summary: Output only. Whether the file was created or opened by the requesting app.

member.summary: Output only. Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string `"drive#file"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.LabelInfo

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.MimeType
member.summary: The MIME type of the file. Google Drive attempts to automatically detect an appropriate value from uploaded content, if no value is provided. The value cannot be changed unless a new revision is uploaded. If a file is created with a Google Doc MIME type, the uploaded content is imported, if possible. The supported import formats are published in the About resource.

member.summary: Output only. Whether the file has been modified by this user.

member.summary: The last time the file was modified by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).

member.summary: he last time the file was modified by anyone (RFC 3339 date-time). Note that setting modifiedTime will also update modifiedByMeTime for the user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ModifiedTimeDateTimeOffset
member.summary: representation of .

member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Name
member.summary: The name of the file. This is not necessarily unique within a folder. Note that for immutable items such as the top level folders of shared drives, My Drive root folder, and Application Data folder the name is constant.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.OriginalFilename
member.summary: The original filename of the uploaded content if available, or else the original value of the `name` field. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.OwnedByMe
member.summary: Output only. Whether the user owns the file. Not populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Owners
member.summary: Output only. The owner of this file. Only certain legacy files may have more than one owner. This field isn't populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Parents
member.summary: The IDs of the parent folders which contain the file. If not specified as part of a create request, the file is placed directly in the user's My Drive folder. If not specified as part of a copy request, the file inherits any discoverable parents of the source file. Update requests must use the `addParents` and `removeParents` parameters to modify the parents list.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.PermissionIds
member.summary: Output only. List of permission IDs for users with access to this file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Permissions
member.summary: Output only. The full list of permissions for the file. This is only available if the requesting user can share the file. Not populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Properties
member.summary: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are visible to all apps. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.QuotaBytesUsed
member.summary: Output only. The number of storage quota bytes used by the file. This includes the head revision as well as previous revisions with `keepForever` enabled.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ResourceKey
member.summary: Output only. A key needed to access the item via a shared link.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Sha1Checksum
member.summary: Output only. The SHA1 checksum associated with this file, if available. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Docs Editors or shortcut files.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Sha256Checksum
member.summary: Output only. The SHA256 checksum associated with this file, if available. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Docs Editors or shortcut files.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Shared
member.summary: Output only. Whether the file has been shared. Not populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.SharedWithMeTimeRaw
member.summary: The time at which the file was shared with the user, if applicable (RFC 3339 date-time).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.SharedWithMeTimeDateTimeOffset
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.SharedWithMeTime
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.SharingUser
member.summary: Output only. The user who shared the file with the requesting user, if applicable.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ShortcutDetails
member.summary: Shortcut file details. Only populated for shortcut files, which have the mimeType field set to `application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Size
member.summary: Output only. Size in bytes of blobs and first party editor files. Won't be populated for files that have no size, like shortcuts and folders.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Spaces
member.summary: Output only. The list of spaces which contain the file. The currently supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Starred
member.summary: Whether the user has starred the file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.TeamDriveId
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `driveId` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ThumbnailLink
member.summary: Output only. A short-lived link to the file's thumbnail, if available. Typically lasts on the order of hours. Only populated when the requesting app can access the file's content. If the file isn't shared publicly, the URL returned in `Files.thumbnailLink` must be fetched using a credentialed request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ThumbnailVersion
member.summary: Output only. The thumbnail version for use in thumbnail cache invalidation.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Trashed
member.summary: Whether the file has been trashed, either explicitly or from a trashed parent folder. Only the owner may trash a file, and other users cannot see files in the owner's trash.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.TrashedTimeRaw
member.summary: The time that the item was trashed (RFC 3339 date-time). Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.TrashedTimeDateTimeOffset
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.TrashedTime
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.TrashingUser
member.summary: Output only. If the file has been explicitly trashed, the user who trashed it. Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.Version
member.summary: Output only. A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.VideoMediaMetadata
member.summary: Output only. Additional metadata about video media. This may not be available immediately upon upload.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ViewedByMe
member.summary: Output only. Whether the file has been viewed by this user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ViewedByMeTimeRaw
member.summary: The last time the file was viewed by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ViewedByMeTimeDateTimeOffset
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.ViewedByMeTime
member.summary: representation of .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.WebContentLink
member.summary: Output only. A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.WebViewLink
member.summary: Output only. A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer in a browser.

member.summary: Whether users with only `writer` permission can modify the file's permissions. Not populated for items in shared drives.

member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanAcceptOwnership
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user is the pending owner of the file. Not populated for shared drive files.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanAddChildren
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can add children to this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanAddFolderFromAnotherDrive
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can add a folder from another drive (different shared drive or My Drive) to this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanAddMyDriveParent
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can add a parent for the item without removing an existing parent in the same request. Not populated for shared drive files.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can change the `copyRequiresWriterPermission` restriction of this file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanChangeSecurityUpdateEnabled
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can change the securityUpdateEnabled field on link share metadata.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanChangeViewersCanCopyContent
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanComment
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can comment on this file.

member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can copy this file. For an item in a shared drive, whether the current user can copy non-folder descendants of this item, or this item itself if it is not a folder.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanDelete
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can delete this file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanDeleteChildren
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can delete children of this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanDownload
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can download this file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanEdit
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can edit this file. Other factors may limit the type of changes a user can make to a file. For example, see `canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission` or `canModifyContent`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanListChildren
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can list the children of this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanModifyContent
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can modify the content of this file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanModifyContentRestriction
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use one of `canModifyEditorContentRestriction`, `canModifyOwnerContentRestriction` or `canRemoveContentRestriction`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanModifyEditorContentRestriction
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can add or modify content restrictions on the file which are editor restricted.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanModifyLabels
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can modify the labels on the file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanModifyOwnerContentRestriction
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can add or modify content restrictions which are owner restricted.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveChildrenOutOfDrive
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can move children of this folder outside of the shared drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveChildrenOutOfTeamDrive
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveChildrenOutOfDrive` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveChildrenWithinDrive
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can move children of this folder within this drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Note that a request to move the child may still fail depending on the current user's access to the child and to the destination folder.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveChildrenWithinTeamDrive
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveChildrenWithinDrive` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveItemIntoTeamDrive
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveItemOutOfDrive` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveItemOutOfDrive
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can move this item outside of this drive by changing its parent. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveItemOutOfTeamDrive
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveItemOutOfDrive` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveItemWithinDrive
member.summary: Output only. Whether the current user can move this item within this drive. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added and the parent that is being removed.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveItemWithinTeamDrive
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveItemWithinDrive` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.File.CapabilitiesData.CanMoveTeamDriveItem
member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canMoveItemWithinDrive` or `canMoveItemOutOfDrive` instead.

member.summary: Deprecated: Output only. Use `canReadDrive` instead.

member.summary: A list of files.

member.summary: The list of files. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.FileList.IncompleteSearch
member.summary: Whether the search process was incomplete. If true, then some search results might be missing, since all documents were not searched. This can occur when searching multiple drives with the 'allDrives' corpora, but all corpora couldn't be searched. When this happens, it's suggested that clients narrow their query by choosing a different corpus such as 'user' or 'drive'.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.FileList.Kind
member.summary: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string `"drive#fileList"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.FileList.NextPageToken
member.summary: The page token for the next page of files. This will be absent if the end of the files list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results. The page token is typically valid for several hours. However, if new items are added or removed, your expected results might differ.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission
member.summary: A permission for a file. A permission grants a user, group, domain, or the world access to a file or a folder hierarchy. Some resource methods (such as `permissions.update`) require a `permissionId`. Use the `permissions.list` method to retrieve the ID for a file, folder, or shared drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.AllowFileDiscovery
member.summary: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search. This is only applicable for permissions of type `domain` or `anyone`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.Deleted
member.summary: Output only. Whether the account associated with this permission has been deleted. This field only pertains to user and group permissions.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.DisplayName
member.summary: Output only. The "pretty" name of the value of the permission. The following is a list of examples for each type of permission: * `user` - User's full name, as defined for their Google account, such as "Joe Smith." * `group` - Name of the Google Group, such as "The Company Administrators." * `domain` - String domain name, such as "thecompany.com." * `anyone` - No `displayName` is present.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.Domain
member.summary: The domain to which this permission refers.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.EmailAddress
member.summary: The email address of the user or group to which this permission refers.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.ExpirationTimeRaw
member.summary: The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time). Expiration times have the following restrictions: - They can only be set on user and group permissions - The time must be in the future - The time cannot be more than a year in the future

member.summary: Whether the account associated with this permission is a pending owner. Only populated for `user` type permissions for files that are not in a shared drive.

member.summary: Output only. Details of whether the permissions on this shared drive item are inherited or directly on this item. This is an output-only field which is present only for shared drive items.

member.summary: Output only. A link to the user's profile photo, if available.

member.summary: The role granted by this permission. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently allowed: * `owner` * `organizer` * `fileOrganizer` * `writer` * `commenter` * `reader`

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.TeamDrivePermissionDetails
member.summary: Output only. Deprecated: Output only. Use `permissionDetails` instead.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.Permission.Type
member.summary: The type of the grantee. Valid values are: * `user` * `group` * `domain` * `anyone` When creating a permission, if `type` is `user` or `group`, you must provide an `emailAddress` for the user or group. When `type` is `domain`, you must provide a `domain`. There isn't extra information required for an `anyone` type.

member.summary: Indicates the view for this permission. Only populated for permissions that belong to a view. 'published' is the only supported value.

member.summary: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible `teamDriveThemes` can be retrieved from a `drive.about.get` response. When not specified on a `drive.teamdrives.create` request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set `colorRgb` or `backgroundImageFile`.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.BackgroundImageFileData
member.summary: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this Team Drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on `drive.teamdrives.update` requests that don't set `themeId`. When specified, all fields of the `backgroundImageFile` must be set.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.BackgroundImageFileData.Id
member.summary: The ID of an image file in Drive to use for the background image.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.BackgroundImageFileData.Width
member.summary: The width of the cropped image in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the width of the cropped image divided by the width of the entire image. The height is computed by applying a width to height aspect ratio of 80 to 9. The resulting image must be at least 1280 pixels wide and 144 pixels high.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.BackgroundImageFileData.XCoordinate
member.summary: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the horizontal distance from the left side of the entire image to the left side of the cropping area divided by the width of the entire image.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.BackgroundImageFileData.YCoordinate
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the vertical distance from the top side of the entire image to the top side of the cropping area divided by the height of the entire image.

member.summary: A set of restrictions that apply to this Team Drive or items inside this Team Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.RestrictionsData.AdminManagedRestrictions
member.summary: Whether administrative privileges on this Team Drive are required to modify restrictions.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.RestrictionsData.CopyRequiresWriterPermission
member.summary: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this Team Drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is set to `true`, it will override the similarly named field to `true` for any file inside this Team Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.RestrictionsData.DomainUsersOnly
member.summary: Whether access to this Team Drive and items inside this Team Drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this Team Drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this Team Drive.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.RestrictionsData.SharingFoldersRequiresOrganizerPermission
member.summary: If true, only users with the organizer role can share folders. If false, users with either the organizer role or the file organizer role can share folders.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDrive.RestrictionsData.TeamMembersOnly
member.summary: Whether access to items inside this Team Drive is restricted to members of this Team Drive.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDriveList
member.summary: A list of Team Drives.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDriveList.Kind
member.summary: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string `"drive#teamDriveList"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDriveList.NextPageToken
member.summary: The page token for the next page of Team Drives. This will be absent if the end of the Team Drives list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results. The page token is typically valid for several hours. However, if new items are added or removed, your expected results might differ.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Drive.v3.Data.TeamDriveList.TeamDrives
member.summary: The list of Team Drives. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.
